Does the Law on Corporate Due Diligence to Prevent Human Rights Violations in Supply Chains (LkSG) apply to your company according to § 1 LkSG?
Can you confirm that your company fulfils the due diligence obligations contained in § 3 paragraph 1 sentence 2 LkSG?

Have you been issued the "Fair Stone" evidence?

Do you contractually obligate your direct suppliers to comply with national environmental laws?
Do you require your direct suppliers to respect human rights?
Do you carry out an annual or event-related risk analysis in your company?
Do you conduct standard on-site inspections/audits of direct suppliers?
Which topics are subject to controls/audits?
Do you check the age of your workers as part of the hiring process?
Is the age of your workers also verified when the hiring process is conducted by placement agencies?
Do you employ persons under the age of 18?
Do you employ persons under the age of 15?
Are there work instructions for which work persons under 18 are not allowed to be employed?
Do persons under the age of 18 perform work for you under water or underground?
Do persons under the age of 18 perform work for you at dangerous heights or in confined spaces?
Do persons under the age of 18 work with dangerous machinery, equipment or tools?
Do people under 18 handle or transport heavy loads in your business?
Do persons under the age of 18 work with hazardous substances, agents or processes?
Do persons under the age of 18 work in areas with harmful temperatures, noise levels or vibrations?
Do persons under the age of 18 work in your company at night time?
Is there a predefined procedure if you suspect that one of your suppliers is unlawfully employing children?
Are persons under the age of 18 in your company in debt bondage, serfdom or forced or compulsory labor?
Is there any work in your company that is only performed when a penalty is threatened (e.g. withholding wages)?
Do you retain the identification documents of your employees?
Do you retain originals or copies of identification documents?
Do you impose penalties on your employees (e.g. withholding of wages, restriction of movement, withholding of identification documents, special work)?
Do you have employees who are so deep in debt to you that it takes them several years to pay off with their wages?
Is the weekly working time (including overtime) more than 60 hours or more than 10 hours per day?
Does your company employ people who have been required to work by the state (e.g. prisoners, military conscripts)?
Is there a predefined procedure if you suspect that forced or slave labor exists at one of your suppliers?
Does your company document the working hours and wages/remuneration of its employees?
Does your company have a health and safety policy that is appropriate for your company?
Does your organization have procedures in place to capture and assess security risks and to correct identified vulnerabilities?
Does your operation work at high altitudes, in confined spaces, or involve very high or low temperatures?
Do you work with hazardous chemical and biological substances?
Does your company have instructions on the use of special safety equipment (e.g. protective clothing)?
Is there a person responsible in your company for the safe storage, distribution and instruction regarding the safe handling of these substances?
Is there technical equipment for emergencies in your company and is it regularly checked and maintained (e.g. fire extinguishing system)?
Are there persons in your company who are specially trained to act in emergencies (e.g. first aid training)?
Does your company offer its employees the opportunity to provide feedback and complaints to management?
Are your employees regularly trained on the subject of occupational safety, especially when they are hired?
Are your employees organized in a union?
Are there bonuses or other benefits, if employees are not members of a union or leave a union?
Are employees hired or assigned to specific tasks based on national or ethnic origin, social origin, health status, disability, sexual orientation, age, gender, political opinion, religion or belief?
Are workers unfairly paid differently for the same work for the reasons mentioned above?
Is there a statutory minimum wage in the country/countries where you work?
Do you pay the respective statutory minimum wage or more?
Do you pay at least a wage that is in line with the general wage level in your industry?
Is the wage reduced for benefits provided by your company to the employee (e.g. for work clothing, meals, accommodation)?
Within the last 20 years, has your company acquired land that was occupied immediately prior to acquisition?
Can you confirm that the land owned or held by your company has not been misappropriated?
Have you acquired any forest land or water bodies in the last 20 years that were not previously used for commercial purposes?
Do you employ security personnel in your company?
Are security personnel tasked with monitoring their workers beyond entry and exit checks?
Has your company defined characteristics/criteria against which relevant environmental impacts can be monitored? (e.g. measurement and monitoring of CO₂ emissions; water consumption)
Have there been any legal proceedings against your company for environmental pollution or similar in the last 5 years?
Are there work instructions and organizational precautions to minimize emissions to air, soil and water?
Does your company have instructions and procedures on how to proceed in case of violation of environmental regulations?
Does your company publish a report on environmental goals and progress?
Does your business generate hazardous waste or does your company work with radioactive substances?
Do you work with an external disposal service provider?
Is the export of hazardous waste documented in your company?
Can you confirm that your company acts in accordance with the Basel Convention on the Control of Transboundary Movements of Hazardous Wastes and their Disposal?
Do you use persistent organic pollutants?
Can you confirm that your company acts in accordance with the Stockholm Convention on Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs)?
Can you confirm that you do not use or manufacture substances listed in Annex I of Regulation (EU) 2019/1021?
Which of the substances listed in Annex I of Regulation (EU) 2019/1021 or in Annex A of the Stockholm POP Convention do you use?
Do you produce mercury in your company or do you use mercury or products containing mercury or do you treat mercury waste?
Can you assure that your company operates in accordance with the Minamata Convention on the Control of Emissions and Releases of the Heavy Metal Mercury?
